title: The Berserker
opening: To the west of Elibe lies an archipelago known as the Western Isles. Here, a sacred weapon lies waiting, the seal guarding it broken. However, to retrieve the weapon, one must pass a trial. Armads, a sacred axe filled with the destructive force of thunder. To wield it, one must prove one's worth. Hector faces a test unlike any he's ever experienced.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Hey, it's pitch black in here! Agh, and it's full of smoke... Hey, Graybeard Athos, you sure this is the right place?

intro.speaker: Athos
intro.line: Yes. Armads, the legendary weapon of Durban the Berserker, who took its name as his own. Armads is here.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: If I've got that, I can help out Eliwood, can't I?

intro.speaker: Athos
intro.line: This battle axe is so tremendous that normal men cannot even lift it. However, it's possible that you might be strong enough.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: C'mon, let's go. I want to get my hands on it!

intro.speaker: Athos
intro.line: Slow down, you fool! The spirits of the soldiers who once fought at our side against the dragons now guard the legendary weapon even in death.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: ...and if I can get through them, I can take the axe, right?

intro.speaker: Athos
intro.line: There are more of them than I'd imagined. You can't do this alone. You must have help.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Fine with me, but how many people can come with me?

intro.speaker: Athos
intro.line: Too many will simply serve to excite the guardians. Call as few allies as possible.

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Bah... I don't get it, but I'll do as you say.

intro.speaker: Athos
intro.line: ...Be on guard, Hector. Every act of strength you perform has consequences...

intro.speaker: Hector
intro.line: Don't worry. I'll get that axe! Now if we're calling allies, let's call them and get moving!

intro.speaker: Athos
intro.line: Hmph... You are a bold one. That is your strength, but also your weakness. Your recklessness may one day be your undoing...

boss.speaker: Kaim
boss.line: I am Kaim. You who search for power... You...must prove your worth to me...

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: All right! This is the throne. Athos Graybeard! I made it!

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: What was...
...Let me fight... Me... Let me fight...

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Wha-What are you supposed to be?
My name is... Durban... I am called... Armads...

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: What is going on here?

end.speaker: Durban
end.line: I am power. Power without peer. I am the dragonhunter. I am the fleshbiter, the bonecrusher, the skullbreaker, the doombringer.

end.speaker: Durban
end.line: I require no seals. I have no need of this idleness called peace. Power unused is power wasted. Better to lie spent in the grave than to sit in wait. I care not who... I would fight someone...

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: This is one dangerous-looking fellow... Hey, Durban... I mean, Armads... Whatever. Doesn't matter. Hey, you, lend me your strength!

end.speaker: Durban
end.line: You desire strength? Then prepare yourself. Once you have gained such power... Your life will not end in a comfortable bed. You will die on the battlefield. In the savage garden of war's bloody delights.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: ...I don't care. I will help my friend. That's why I've come this far. Armads! Your power! Lend it to me.

end.speaker: Durban
end.line: ...It is yours.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Hector!

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: What have you been doing? I'm glad to see that you're well...

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Hey, I told you not to worry. Here, look at this. It's the thunder hammer.

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: So, you have acquired Armads, have you, Hector?

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Yep. Okay Eliwood, now it's your turn.

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: Mm, let's go!

end.speaker: Athos
end.line: We will not leave Eliwood to his task, and wait outside.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: I wonder if Eliwood is all right.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: He is. No need to worry about Eliwood.

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: You're right.

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: Aha! Look! He's coming out!

end.speaker: Hector
end.line: So this is the legendary blade...

end.speaker: Lyn
end.line: Durandal, the sword of sacred fire. ...It's strange, isn't it? I've never seen it before, but it feels so familiar...

end.speaker: Eliwood
end.line: I will use this to battle Nergal. Come! To the Dragon's Gate... What?!
